title.narrative: Civil Society Support Program II - FCDO
Civil Society Support Program II - FCDO

description.narrative:
Programmet för civila samhället II (CSSP II) är ett givargemensamt program som ger finansiellt stöd till civila samhället organisationer i Etiopien.
Programmet finansieras av Irland, DfiD, Norge och Sverige. Den totala budgeten för programmet uppgår till MSEK 201. Sveriges bidrag är SEK 30 MSEK, Irlands bidrag är 37.8 MSEK, Norge 26 MSEK och Dfids bidrag uppgår till SEK 107 147 000.
Programmet syftar till att bygga en kritisk massa av organisationer som har kapacitet och kompetens att svara mot de behov och rättigheter som fattiga kvinnor, män och barn har. Insatsen ska genomföras under perioden 2018-2021.

The Civil Society Support Program II (CSSP II) is a joint Donor Pooled Funding of Civil Society Organizations. Currently, it is funded by Irish Aid, Dfid, Norway and Sweden. The total budget of the program is 201MSEK, out of which Sweden’s contribution is 30 MSEK, Irish aid will contribute 37.8MSEK, Norway will contribute 26 MSEK and Dfid's contribution is of 107, 147,000 SEK.
The program aims at building a critical mass of CSOs, which have the capability to respond to development priorities determined by the poor. The program is planned to be implemented during the period 2018-2021.

The intended impact of CSSP II is to increase trust between government and civil society resulting in more equitable and better quality public public services. The objectives of the program are: 1) Competitive grants for CSOs 2) Capacity building The project contributes to objective 2, Strengthened democracy and gender equality, and greater respect for human rights, in particular objective 2.3, Strengthened capacity of civil society to promote openness, accountability and greater respect for human rights, in the Strategy for Sweden's development cooperation with Ethiopia 2016-2020 (extended until end of 2022).

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

description.narrative: Results achieved in 2020 Despite the challenges posed by natural calamities, COVID-19 pandemics, restrictions imposed by the State of Emergency and instability in the country, CSSP2 has achieved the following outcomes in 2020. Covid 19 reporgramming - CSSP2 has taken rapid response on COVID-19 prevention and response measures. Accordingly, CSSP2 has developed COVID-19 response and eligibility guidelines and awarded COVID-19 prevention and response project for consortia of 17 local CSOs. CSSP2 has also processed 21 pivoting requests from its existing partners and signed contract amendments. Accordingly, resource amounting ETB 13,430,913.06 (equivalent to 4.5MSEK) shifted to support COVID-19 prevention and response measures in the exiting strategic thematic areas. The CSSP 2 has three workstands: Grant making, Capacity Development and Engagement. Grant making In the reporting year, it is reported that "CSSP2 have conducted fund disbursements, due diligence assessments, report reviews, grant amendments, compliance supports, and project closures for its existing grant projects". As stated above, new grants have only been made through Covid-19 re-purposing. The remaining grant disbursement was made as a second tranche payment for existing CSOs (20 CSOs). Due diligence assessments (DDAs): it was reported that "the urgency of grant making process coupled with large number of applicants, CSSP2 and DFID agreed that DDAs for co-implementing CSOs of 21 grants, which is contracted out in October 2019, to be handled by the respective lead CSOs before the grant contract, and CSSP2 to verify the DDAs made by the lead applicants during the project implementation period, November 2019 onwards. As a result, CSSP2 verified DDAs for 50 co-implementing CSOs in 2020, and shared its feedback for learning, and/ or actions/improvement. Moreover; DDA was done for 12 local CSOs which are contracted out under COVID-19 response grant in October 2020". Capacity Development Under its capacity development track, it was reported that "CSSP2 has delivered different CD trainings in 2020, to all of its strategic and COVID-19 prevention and response grantees. The delivered CD trainings include outcome mapping, policy advocacy, human rights-based approach (HRBA), grant and finance management, GESI, safeguarding, diversifying funding sources, strategic planning, coalition facilitation and management; adaptive programming; rapid context analysis, conflict sensitive programming, media for advocacy and influence, and active citizenships. In total, 423 participants (94 female) from both the lead and co-implementing partners were attended the workshop in different rounds. CSSP2 has also conducted Re-OCA and Re-ReOCA workshops workshop for 15 and 4 CSO partners respectively. The workshops were attended by 93 people (21 female). The findings of these assessments reveal that all of the reassessed CSO partners (100%) show positive progress in their OCA results". Engagement IT was reported that "in view of equipping CSO regulatory institutions with the required technical capacity and operational modality to foster collaboration between CSOs and government, CSSP2 has provided capacity development training to 258 Agency for Civil Society Organisations (ACSO) staff (47 female) focusing on team building, communication skills, appreciative inquiry, facilitation skills, project cycle management (PCM), action research and supportive monitoring to top and middle level managers. In addition, CSSP2 has delivered capacity development training for other eight relevant government sector ministries focusing on the familiarization of the revised CSO law, and participatory monitoring and evaluation approaches. These technical supports were highly welcomed and appreciated by the participants, and further solidified the collaboration between CSSP2 and relevant sector ministries. It has also attributed to the sector’s effort to transform CSO’s perception amongst government. Safeguarding capacity building supports were also provided to CSOs through bi-weekly virtual consultation forums whereby trainings were provided by CSSP2 safeguarding grantees- Hiwot Ethiopia and CHADET. These capacity development platforms build on the safeguarding assessment results which are identified through CSSP2’s reports of partners’ OCA". Financial overview: It is reported that "the approved Year 3 budget from January to December 2020 was £6,259,345 (this was revised to £4,822,835). The total spend for Year 3 was £3,976,974 which represents 64% utilization/burn rates. The -36% (£845,661) variance is mainly driven by impact on Covid-19 on grants (£1,968,572) since there was a grand round that was cancelled. Partners’ capacity to catch up on their activities has been hindered by the government restrictions on movements. These restrictions have further impacted the following budgets: Monitoring and evaluation (£82,674), Travel, Subsistence and Accommodation (£177,217) and other directs costs (£102,850), particularly office costs".
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
